ai.summary: A tiny, easy trail named Carn Brea FP 23 in the UK. At 0.3 km, this gentle stroll is ideal for families and beginners seeking a quick outdoor experience with minimal effort.
ai.terrain_summary: A short, well-maintained footpath with mostly flat or gently undulating ground. Expect a surface of compact earth and gravel, with occasional uneven or loose stones.
ai.safety_notes: Even on short, easy routes, wear sturdy footwear, stay on marked paths, and watch for uneven ground or weather-related hazards. Keep young children supervised, bring water on sunny days, and check for any trail notices or closures before you go.
ai.best_seasons: All year round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and autumn when temperatures are mild.
